comments:
Build 20011218

1. Unzip eclipse-SDK-20011218-win32.zip to d:\temp\
2. Download pde plugin found at http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%
7Echeckout%7E/jdt-ui-home/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.selfhosting/index.html
3. Install this plugin in d:\temp\eclipse\plugins
4. Start eclipse.exe with a JDK1.4beta3 VM
5. File->Import->Plugins->d:\temp\eclipse\plugins->Finish
6. Open Java perspective
7. F11->Select org.eclipse.pde.selfhosting->Choose the Eclipse launcher-> 
d:\temp\target (for the workspace data)->Finish
8. In the target workspace, open the Java perspective
9. Create a new Java project Proj
10. Open the search dialog and switch to Java Search
11. Enter java.lang.String.*
12. Select Field and References
13. Press Search
Observe: It is not doing anything.
Going to the debugger in the development workspace, attempting to suspend the 
[main] thread results in a timeout exception. Also the debugger doesn't show 
all threads (the [Java indexing] thread is missing.

The debugger works for me. However, I suspended the main thread a few times, 
and eventaully got an error message in the target IDE, with the following error 
in the log. 

Moving to JDT UI/Search

Log: Thu Feb 28 11:37:47 CST 2002
4 org.eclipse.jdt.ui 1 Internal Error
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

The out of memory error got fixed and we haven't seen problem reported like 
this - closing.
